strings.string: The ceiling opens and cinderblocks fall on you!\r
\rThere doesn't appear to be any way into this building.\r
\rThis is a neat, somewhat clean room (except for the bloody mess you left in the entrance).\r
\rThis is a working howitzer. You don't see any shells around, though.\r
\rA former sports car, destroyed by howitzer fire.\r
This is a fast food stand. A girl behind the counter says, "Welcome to Hobo Dogs. Items are $5 each. Would you like to order?\r\r\x11\x10Yes\r\x10No\r
Choose:\r\r\x11\x10A) Hobo Dog\r\x10B) French-fried fingers\r\x10C) Barbecued brains\r\x10D) Scalps over-easy\r\x10E) Tramp's rump\r\x10F) Blood sausage\r
\rMmmm. This dog made Hobo Dog famous.\r
\rLight and sweet - and so good for you!\r
\rThis tough, tasteless meat strains your teeth.\r
\rA sign just inside the entrance says "Bill Dugan, Representative, Temple of Blood."\r
\rPamphlets lay here describing the tough criteria for Temple initiates.\r
\rA barren desk. Looks like someone's on vacation.\r
\rThis door is locked. On it is painted a picture of a staff superimposed on a convex disk.\r
\rThis is a tree. Don't walk into too many of them.\r
\rAn accordion player rushes over and starts playing "Intruder". He doesn't want money, just practice.\r
\rThis table has graffiti carved all over the top.\r
\rThis is a large wooden platform, with lots of tables and chairs for customers of restaurants in the area.\r
\rA poor bum squints up at you and begs, "Gimme sum squeezins?"\r
\rHe sucks the bottle dry and falls asleep.\r
\rHe drinks and falls asleep, mumbling, "Damn Acapulco club... Lost all my money..."\r
\rThe railing prevents people from climbing over.\r
You screw up somehow and the shell explodes!\r
A vendor has bottles on a bandolizer around his chest. "Want some snake squeezins? Best around, for $15!"\r\r\x11\x10Yes\r\x10No\r
\rYou stand in the middle of a wide asphalt road in a rundown neighborhood.\r
\rThis former wall is part of a building that appears to be totally shattered by explosions.\r
\r"Crowley's Occult Shop". There's a clerk with a foot-long beard sleeping in a corner. Shelves hold various mystical items.\r
\rInstruction books for fortune telling, palm reading, and dowsing.\r
\rSpell books. No, the spells don't work.\r
\rYou look into the crystal ball and you see...you see...you see an angry wizard on a mountain screaming, "What do you think this is, Bard's Tale?!"\r
\rIt's no use trying to wake up the proprietor. He's been asleep for weeks, it seems.\r
\rThe shell slides into place with a "click!"\r
\rThe ceiling opens and cinderblocks fall from above, but they all miraculously miss you!\r
\rThis shelf has a crystal ball on it.\r
\rHey, don't walk on the table. This used to be a nice place.\r
\rIf you are that enthusiastic to get liquor, why don't you buy some?\r
\rThe crater is ten feet deep; you'll have to climb.\r
\rYou start to slip but you catch yourself before you fall.\r
\rThe girl behind the counter, writhing and bleeding, gasps, "Would you like ... fries with your ... order?" She dies.\r
\rYou can't buy hot dogs here anymore since some nameless scum blew up the building.\r
\rThe explosion made all this part of the platform collapse. You'll have to try to climb through the rubble.\r
\rThe wall has collapsed into impassable rubble.\r
\rThis abandoned art gallery is now a shelter for those homeless people who don't want to become Hobo Dogs.\r
\rYou can't walk through, step on, or trample the bum.\r
\rThis Hollywood-style shop used to sell movie stills, posters, press kits, and scripts, but all of the stuff has been ripped. All that remains are some posters, sealed to the wall behind plastic.\r
\rA howitzer, blown to bits because of mishandled shell loading!\r
You can fire the shell:\r\r\x11\x10A) West, low trajectory\r\x10B) West, high\r\x10C) Southwest, low\r\x10D) Southwest, high\r\x10E) South, low\r\x10F) South, high\r
\rYour other party is swamped in rubble from the explosion!\r
\rBOOM! The shell arcs high and impacts with an explosion!\r

\rA computer software poster reads,\r "WASTELAND!"\r\rIBM VERSION: Michael Quarles\rORIGINAL PROGRAM: Alan "T.J." Pavlish\rDESIGN:\rBrian Fargo........Alan "T.J." Pavlish\rKen St. Andre.....Michael A. Stackpole\rMAPS:\rBruce Balfour....Elizabeth T. Danforth\rChris Christensen...Jeff "T.G." Berman\rBill "Weez" Dugan.....Nishan Hossepian\rStance Nixon.......Alan "T.J." Pavlish\rKen St. Andre.....Michael A. Stackpole\rMike Williams............Daniel Carver\rGRAPHICS:\rTodd J. Camasta........Charles Weidman\rBruce Schlickbernd\rDIRECTED BY:\rTroy P. Worrell\rPLAYTEST & DEVELOPMENT:\rBruce "Redbeard" Schlickbernd\rTom Decker\rMORAL SUPPORT:\rSusan Quarles\r\rRated PG-13.\rComing soon to a theatre near you.\r\r
\rA poster reads, "You've played the game, now experience the movie: Crater Raider".\r
\rA poster says, "Gone With the Nuke Storm".\r
\rThere's a bulletin board on the south wall.\r
\rYou can't go past the mangled edge of the wrecked platform.\r
\rA sign above the table says, "Bloodstaff verification table. Place bloodstaff to be verified on table."\r
